definition: the delivery and collection of letters and packages, publicize with, or as if with, a poster
details:
noun
- the delivery and collection of letters and packages
= example: the delivery and collection of letters and packages
- a job in an organization
= example: a job in an organization
= synonyms: spot
- military installation at which a body of troops is stationed
= example: military installation at which a body of troops is stationed
= synonyms: military post
- an upright consisting of a piece of timber or metal fixed firmly in an upright position
= example: an upright consisting of a piece of timber or metal fixed firmly in an upright position
- the system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office
= synonyms: mail, mail service, postal service
- a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track)
= example: a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track)
= synonyms: stake
- any particular collection of letters or packages that is delivered
= synonyms: mail
- the position where someone (as a guard or sentry) stands or is assigned to stand
= example: the position where someone (as a guard or sentry) stands or is assigned to stand
= synonyms: station
verb
- publicize with, or as if with, a poster
= example: publicize with, or as if with, a poster
- display, as of records in sports games
- mark or expose as infamous
= synonyms: brand
- cause to be directed or transmitted to another place
= synonyms: mail, send
- assign to a station
= synonyms: place, station, send
- place so as to be noticed
= example: place so as to be noticed
= synonyms: put up
- mark with a stake
= synonyms: stake
- affix in a public place or for public notice
= example: affix in a public place or for public notice
- ride Western style and bob up and down in the saddle in rhythm with a horse's trotting gait
- transfer (entries) from one account book to another
= synonyms: carry
- assign to a post
= example: assign to a post
- enter on a public list
